work.name: University of Toronto
work.summary: Teaching assistant for the course CSC343 - Introduction to Databases at the University of Toronto.
highlights: Manage discussion board to address students' questions

courses: Advanced LLM and Distributed Systems for Personalized AI
Comparative and Empirical Analysis of LLMs versus SLMs

research.name: Advanced LLM and Distributed Systems (University of Toronto)
research.summary: Develop and utilize small language models in conjunction with Retrieve and Generate (RAG) architecture to construct personalized AI systems.

research.name: Comparative and Empirical Analysis of LLMs versus SLMs (University of Toronto)
research.summary: Conduct comparative and empirical analysis of large language models (LLMs) and small language models (SLMs) to evaluate their performance and efficiency.

publications.name: Can Small Language Models With Retrieval-Augmented Generation Replace Large Language Models When Learning Computer Science?
publications.summary: The paper explores the efficacy of locally-stored Small Language Models (SLMs) with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) methods compared to cloud-based Large Language Models (LLMs) like gpt-3.5-turbo and gpt-4-32k, demonstrating that SLMs with RAG can offer comparable or superior performance in aiding computing students' learning, thereby enabling educators to maintain control over data security and privacy in educational settings.

projects.name: AI - Assistant
projects.summary: An AI Chatbot utilizing the Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) method, designed to function as a virtual assistant. It is tailored to address users' individual needs and queries. Specifically implemented within 300-level and 400-level Computer Science courses at the University of Toronto, it serves as an adjunct teaching assistant, providing support and guidance to students.

projects.name: PlayPal
projects.summary: A web application which facilitates individuals finding people to play sports together, simplify the process of finding sports partners and organizing sports activities and fostering a community of sports enthusiasts.
highlights: Django REST framework, Next.js, JWT, CI/CD, PayPal API

projects.name: Easy Chef
projects.summary: A social media platform designed for users to share and discover recipes.

projects.name: r/place
projects.summary: A replica of Reddit's "r/place" using resources provided by Amazon Web Services (AWS).

projects.name: URL Shortener
projects.summary: A distributed URL shortener system inspired by bit.ly.

projects.name: Neural Style Transfer
projects.summary: A neural style transfer system that applies the style of one image to the content of another image.

projects.name: mysh
projects.summary: A robust Unix shell program that supports basic shell commands and piping.
